x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement:
Millions of Nigerians operate in the informal economy; Artisans, drivers, traders, and freelancers who earn daily income but lack access to credit or formal banking systems.
Traditional credit models depend on payslips, bank statements, or collateral, leaving these workers invisible to financial institutions. Yet they demonstrate reliability through consistent work, peer reputation, and transaction history, data that often goes unrecorded.
There’s an urgent need for a digital system that recognizes this informal trust and translates it into tangible financial credibility.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.project_name: CrediNow: AI-Powered Credit and Reliability Scoring for Informal Workers
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

App Engine / Studio: builds custom data models for worker profiles, transaction logs, peer ratings, and trust scores.

Predictive Intelligence / Machine Learning: analyzes behavior and engagement patterns to generate dynamic reliability or “trust” scores.

IntegrationHub: connects with payment apps, gig platforms, or microfinance systems to import real-world transaction data.

Flow Designer: automates scoring, notifications, and referral recommendations for eligible users.

Service Portal / Experience Sites: provides a clean interface for users to check scores, request micro-loans, and manage their profile.

Mobile App: lets informal workers easily log daily income, track trust growth, and receive offers from verified lenders.

Performance Analytics: measures inclusion impact, average credit increase, and engagement by region.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

Data Integration APIs: links to POS systems, payment apps, and gig platforms (e.g., Opay, PalmPay, Jumia, Bolt).

Identity Verification API: uses NIN or BVN for basic validation.

AI Model Training Pipeline: ensures fairness and transparency in scoring.

SMS/USSD Integration: supports users with non-smartphones.

Partnership with Microfinance Institutions: enables real-world loan access and feedback loops.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Data Privacy & Ethics: ensuring AI scoring models are fair and explainable.
  • Verification: maintaining identity integrity in a largely informal ecosystem.
  • Adoption Barriers: building trust among users who fear exploitation or bias.
  • Partnerships: aligning banks, fintechs, and local cooperatives under shared standards.
  • Infrastructure: managing intermittent connectivity and inconsistent data sources.
